Articles.Content:
Hey, guys. DoctorSpaceman here! Just wondering if anybody around here plays SCP:CB or reads the SCP wiki. There were a couple of old threads on this topic, but they were dead. It's gotten pretty popular lately, and I figured I'd make a new thread for it. I'm actually a member on their site, from back before it was cool, and I'm glad it's getting more recognition.

My favorite SCP so far?

SCP-006-J

Absolutely. Frickin. Hilarious.
Ah god. That derpy bear thing is creepy. I've only watched video of it.

Ah god. That derpy bear thing is creepy. I've only watched video of it.

173 is creepy, 106 makes you sleep with the lights on.

1322, an unfortunate story of carelessness..

Edited July 11, 2013 by Jones-250

Most of the Keters are interesting to read, one of my favourites must be Blade, I forgot his SCP number, but he was the Sumerian dude who can materialize scimitars from miniature black holes and is regenerative.
I love that game. It is kinda hard but it is awsome. I also played SCP-073-B, which is made for a quick scare
Yeah lol you guys should read SCP-871. Keter+Cake=Winning

hnng

SCP: Containment Breach has to be the scariest free indie horror game ever created. Slender: The Eight Pages is scary, but SCP:CB is far scarier, mostly due to SCP-106. You never know when he's going to pop up, and in places where he does consistently pop up, you're constantly on edge. Also, SCP-173.

Also, I've never beaten the game. Too stressful. I'm on edge the entire time and it frays my nerves.
